meanings.def: a unit that can form part of a course of study, especially at a college or university in the UK
examples: The course consists of ten core modules and five optional modules.
Participants who complete 10 online modules will receive their certificates in June.
The course material is divided into four modules.

meanings.def: a unit of a computer system or program that has a particular function
examples: You can buy memory modules to increase storage capacity.
New software modules include a virtual memory tool.

meanings.def: one of a set of separate parts or units that can be joined together to make a machine, a piece of furniture, a building, etc.
examples: Ships are now built in modules rather than built in a whole from the base up.

meanings.def: a unit of a spacecraft that can function independently of the main part
examples: Photographs were taken from a lunar module
the tiny command module of the spaceship
